For a  game that took me roughly 9 hours too complete, Infinite is one of my all time favourites.The beautiful setting of Columbia is one of the most amazing experiences, unlike the dark and tragic setting of its predecessors. The only let down would be the ending. while it is insightful, its mostly depressing, and feels more like a let down. It would've been nice if it had alternate endings like the first to games, but at least it helps us understand the original setting for our protagonists quest. The fact that its also quite well-read in terms of its scientific parts is that added touch, so it has some real possibility we could have a Columbia like the one in the game...

Oh yeah, Elizabeths pretty hot too. (better with the ponytail imo)
brilliant game. I've replayed it about 4 times already

Just finished the game, it have a really good story, it's the best one of the series, Elizabeth make the game have an unique gameplay feel. I recommend it even if you didn't liked the previous series.

Muy buen juego. Este juego si tengo que darle una calificación a esta entrega sería un 8.5, La historia es maravillosa, tanto la primera vez que lo pasas como cuando lo pasas por tercera vez, cada vez que lo vuelves a jugar descubres más argumento qué se relaciona perfectamente, la historia es muy elaborada y llamativa, sobre la cuestion tecnica no tengo ninguna queja, visualmente hablando es muy bonito y completos los escenarios que este muestra.

Si te preguntas si este juego vale la pena comprarlo, creeme que si lo vale en todos sus aspectos
je to skvela hra , či hratelne alebo pribehovo

Evidemment, très bon jeu ! Un poile en dessous des 2 précédents volets. La Direction Artistique est superbe, Columbia nous en met vraiment plein les yeux (c’est aussi le premier jeu que je fais en 1080p avec ma nouvelle GTX 1070 avec tout à fond, donc j’étais impressionné.) On a autant de plaisir que lorsqu’on entre dans rapture pour la premiere fois.
J’ai entendu dire que les développeurs voulaient faire peur, ou du moins créer un sentiment d’angoisse tout en utilisant des couleurs chaudes etc… ben c’est raté ! La  ou les 2 premiers Bioshocks pouvaient être dérangeant de par leur ambiance, Infinite n’arrive pas du tout a provoquer un sentiment aussi fort. Les armes et pouvoirs  sont cool, les environnements sympa. J’en attendais un peu plus du cote des ennemis, mais j’me suis bien amuse dans les phases de baston.
Gros bemole : comme le jeu sauvegarde automatiquement, on peu pas jouer a deux au jeu (chacun sa sauvegarde), c’est pénible.
Temps de jeu en difficile : Infinite 16h, Burial at Sea 4h par épisode a peu prés. (J'ai adore le gameplay de Burial at Sea l'episode 2, plus oriente infiltration)
Le seul problème que j’ai avec ce titre est son histoire alambique comme pas permis, on s’y perd, c’est bourre de paradoxe et de contradictions, un vrai bordel. Juste pour être sure j’suis allé regarder des vidéos pour décortiquer l’histoire pour voir, et ben non, je confirme, l’histoire marche pas pour moi (et j’suis pas le seul). J’en dirai pas plus pour rien spoiler. Enfin ca reste un super jeu.

So wie viele andere würde ich jetzt nicht behaupten das Infinite der schlechteste Teil der Reihe ist.

Wobei ich bei dem Punkt, dass man die Fähigkeiten nicht mehr so gezielt und durchdacht benutzen muss wie z.B. in BioShock2 nur zustimmen kann. 
Der Shooteraspekt in der BioShock Reihe ist ja auch mehr nur Nebensache da die Story mehr im Vordergrund steht.

Diese hat mich persönlich sehr gepackt und wurde interessant erzählt [spoiler] zum Ende hin mit dem ständigen Wechseln der Zeitlinien und das Ende selbst in dem man sich ja opfert fand ich etwas seltsam, da nach der Logik das noch Millionen andere Welten bestehen es ja immer noch eine geben würde in der Comstock bzw. Booker DeWitt leben. Und das die beiden die selbe Person sein sollen ist sowieso so... wtf?! [/spoiler]

BioShock Infinite is the final entry in the BioShock franchise, and while it's quite different from the previous two games, I think it's a good way to end; especially once you play through Burial at Sea - Episode Two; but I'll talk about that in its own review. This one will talk exclusively about the main game, while I'll write reviews for each of the DLCs. So, on to the review!

What should I talk about first? I guess gameplay would be an important factor. In BioShock Infinite, the combat feels more frenetic; so to speak. Rather than focusing on exploration like the previous games, you'll usually move from one combat arena to the other; not literally, of course, there will be moments where you're free to explore a bit, but the game still feels pretty combat oriented. Not that it's something bad, considering that, in my opinion, the combat in this game is pretty good, with lots of options to dispatch enemies; from the different weapons, to the Vigors (Infinite's version of Plasmids), and Elizabeth's Tears. If there's something I'd complain about, though, is the fact that you're limited to carrying two weapons at the same time. Somewhat disappointing, but the variety of Vigors (and Vigor Combos) more than makes up for this. Also, the Sky-Hook is a great addition, allowing you to quickly move through certain areas, while also working as a melee weapon. Finally, there's the Tears. Elizabeth, who will be your companion for most of the game, can open them to bring things to help you out during combat, which is quite useful.

As for the story, well, it's pretty good in my opinion. It starts out somewhat "normal"; you're a guy sent to the city of Columbia to rescue a certain girl, but as it progresses, it gets more and more complex, in a good way. The characters are all pretty well written in my opinion, and a particular mention goes to the Lutece twins. Their dialogue always cracks me up a bit. Some people might feel that the main character, Booker, feels like a "regular" hero; you know, guy with a dark past, atoning for his sins, etc. Well, I'd say that's because, while being the playable character, Booker isn't the main character. The main character would be Elizabeth, and when you play through the game, it kinda makes sense. The story isn't about Booker's trip to Columbia, but rather about Elizabeth escaping from Columbia.

And now, I'll dedicate a paragraph to Elizabeth. Like I mentioned above, I feel that the game is more about Elizabeth than about Booker. After all, she is kind of the driving force behind the plot; what moves it forward. And like I also mentioned, she'll be your companion for most of the game. Even then, the game doesn't feel like a long escort mission. During combat, Elizabeth helps you out; not fighting enemies directly, but by providing you supplies, opening tears to bring in help, and even warning you of powerful enemies. Outside combat, she'll wander on her own; not going too far away from you, but she'll still look at things that interest her, and might even find things you missed; she can also open doors for you through lockpicking. I think they did a great job at giving her a personality; she doesn't feel like another NPC at all, but rather as an actual person. Still, there are a few details here and there; just as an example, when lockpicking, she'll usually talk in a cheerful tone, which can feel out of place when, only a few minutes before, she was angry at Booker for something he did.

The environments are superb. The city of Columbia is a pretty beautiful place, and I can see why they went with the "city in the sky" theme rather than going back to the bottom of the ocean. Not to say that Rapture wouldn't have looked good; in fact, you'll get to visit it in its prime in Burial at Sea! However, having a different setting was interesting, with 1912's Columbia providing a nice contrast to 1950's Rapture. The level design, by itself, is pretty good; still, most of the places you'll visit feel like combat arenas, consisting of big, open spaces, unlike Rapture's labyrinth-like structure. The soundtrack is pretty good as well.

Well, I think that's all I can say about BioShock Infinite. Personally, my favourite BioShock game is BioShock 2, but even then, I think Infinite is an excellent game, which is why I recommend it.

操作手感音乐什么都很好，只想评论剧情，剧透慎入剧透慎入剧透慎入剧透慎入剧透慎入。一开始明亮温暖悠闲的美好画面让我以为是轻小说游戏，捡到枪突突突之后时候觉得是奇幻风格FPS游戏，玩到中间有一段尼玛简直是在玩恶灵附身吓死爹了，最后准备迎来最终一战的时候剧情莫名奇妙让主角地把大BOSS溺死了。。。然后本来以为战胜了邪恶势力，将要迎来新生活的我，在精神分裂转换无数个场景之后，看着主角被N个萌妹子溺死在了河里。。。查了下百度才大致理解了剧情，这个结局让人感觉非常不是滋味，浑身难受，因为我一直是一个期望HE的玩家，但是同时也为这种构思巧妙精细的剧情所折服，就如同看完一部电影一般需要细细琢磨。

给老子买！
Fucking love this game. I'll miss you Elizabeth <3

I really did't like the first two parts of the series Bioshock. BUT IN THIS PART I FELL HEAD OVER HEELS IN LOVE.
In this part of the undersea Rapture get to sky-Columbia, saturated - it would seem - sweetness straight from the 30s, but the action itself takes place in 1912. As DeWitt Booker we get the opportunity to pay off our debt gambling, and this is associated with saving a woman named Elizabeth. Description straight from the many films and criminal action? So it would seem. Soon, however, we find that same place, people, and the whole course of events that drive these characters is in no way flattened. This gives us an extraordinary historical outline and plot of which is not going to get away, even for a moment. Hard and snappy hero is a perfect contrast to the wonderful, sweet and slightly lost as Elizabeth, and it is enough that we feel torn between the two different worlds of black and white.
The game offers a nice variety of arsenal and skills that will help us in the execution of our task to both "land" and in the skies.

Plus:
[list]
[*]Stock conveying the great atmosphere of steampunk Columbia
[*]Great music
[*]Extremely well-designed locations
[*]Brilliantly sketched characters
[*]Dynamic, action-packed fight
[*]One of the best storylines in games, and I love the game focused on the story.
[*]Elizabeth <3 <3 <3 <3
[/list]

̶M̶i̶n̶u̶s̶e̶s̶:̶
FCK, THIS GAME HAS NO DISADVANTAGES!
不負藝術之名

Однообразная игра. Как экшен она конечна хороша, а в целом наскучила уже на 30% игры. Стреляешь стреляешь стреляешь, и все однотипно начиная с 1-ой миссии. Конечно сюжет у игры замечателен, да и дизайнеры постарались. Но геймплея по факту 0.

Probabilmente la migliore conclusione per una saga del genere. Il gioco riesce a tenere testa agli standard di qualità imposti dal primo capitolo, con una storia emozionante e coinvolgente ed un gameplay davvero ben fatto. 
Più che consigliato
I love it!

I've just finished the game on Normal and I must admit this is a FANTASTIC game. Although the plot is a bit convoluted, borderline Inception like, the graphics, character models and just the world in general is just breathtaking. My first step into Columbia made me want to take thousands of screenshots. This game is a definite must and I'd recommend it to any casual gamers like myself who like a challenging yet relaxing game. The deaths do not punish too heavily and the game is always there to help you along. 8/10
Definitely lives up to all of the hype. Beautifully produced soundtrack from start to finish. Easily my favorite from the series.

One of the beautiful game with the finest ending 
wow

One of my favorite games to date! Story, graphics, and game immersion are all great. While it has a fairly linear story, there are a couple sidequests that help you get into the lore of the game. 10/10 suggested. Not much replay value, but a great game that makes you hope for a fourth!

剧情跌宕起伏，引人入胜，画面细腻精美，战斗系统丰富，更有可治愈可捡钱可补魔萝莉，满分作品。

比本体还大的dlc，更充实的剧情。
Достойное продолжение полюбившейся франшизы и мира. Очень атмосферно и интересно познавать все уголки этого мира и распутывать хитросплетения сюжета. Крутая задумка, Спасибо разработчикам!

Been standing in Booker's boots; got debt, given a chance to clean own slate, blasted to the sky, dunked by a priest, took a stroll on the beautiful streets and buildings among the clouds, and then everything went screwed up. From pipping hot frying pan to the infernal stove, no worries for the weapons are almost everywhere even when cops and rebels are ahead of you. 
Turned out the damsel in distress became quite a partner and tossed me stuffs often. When the girl yells and tosses you a gun, trust me, better to catch it than sorry. Best, most useful heroine I've ever seen and interact with.

The story? Man, never been fucked up like this. Unexpected, and baffled me for moments. 
Been in Rapture, twice to be exact, and a brief revisit to the city under the ocean gave me chill and nostalgia at the same time. The previous installments have such mind-boggling story, but this one gave me a wholly new level of being mindfucked.

The arsenal Columbia offered is delicious; in fact, the six-shooter Hand Cannon in Columbia is the best I've ever handle. Never missed my mark, every bullet counts. Seeing helmets and hats flung off one's head gave me the savor of gunslinging action. One of the most satisfying shooting gallery I've ever experienced.

9/10 would get myself around Elizabeth again.
one of the best games i played
光怪陆离的蒸汽乌托邦
Awesome.
This game is a masterpiece simple as that.The gameplay is a normal fps with superpowers(vigors) however the story is straight 10 and should be experienced by everyone.

Without reservation or hesitation I can whole heartedly recommend this beautiful game. A lot of people have pointed out flaws, and they are correct and right to - but for what it and it's DLC does for the bioshock series as a whole, and for gaming: Buy it, full price if necessary. The gameplay is fun and the story is beyond compelling, only draw back is that ocasionally these two elements fight, the main campaigne can get a little linear and the game did fall far short of what was advertised in the earlier trailers, but this game has given me some of my favourite stories and most beloved character ever: Anna Dewit, she is brilliantly written in code and in narative, no gamer could ask for a better companion :) Ken Levine, you've done good!

想完整理解这个游戏的剧情，生化奇兵1代必玩，三代的海葬dlc必玩，另外生化奇兵历来地图上都有很多探索的点，多四处逛逛收集各种东西对理解剧情和战斗都有好处，游戏没得说，10/10。但是这么多年了，2k还是没给出海葬dlc的游戏音乐相关信息，更不说下载了，唯一的信息只有游戏结束的credit列表里那几行几乎没人会留意的字，这游戏配乐真心好，[strike]搞不到到伊丽莎白唱的you belong to me真是好气好气啊(╯▔皿▔)╯‘[/strike]，海葬dlc游戏音乐资源的问题已经解决，多亏评论里提醒，这里我就把ost的链接直接放上来了，另外云音乐搜Courtnee Draper的那首you belong to me就是了

名不虚传

I paid the full price for this game... and it was worth every cent! The game took me about fifteen hours (do note though that this was my first ever first person shooter game). 
The story is what really made the game for me. I was Booker DeWitt on his mission to 'bring us the girl and wipe away the debt', and I felt at one with him as he changes his desisions throughout the game. Basically the pacing feels right. 
The 'cut-scenes' are the best I've ever played, they are in game material still and you can look around and see the ground shake beneath you during most of them. 
You don't play this game, you live in this life. 
The characters are brilliant, Booker and Elizabeth are relatable! The graphics are great, 10/10!
无论是剧情还是画面还是操作手感上都是一款不可多得的好游戏。

I really enjoyed this game. It ran well. The gun play is fun. The story was alright. I got it on sale and it was worth what I paid and more. It was a great introduction into the bioshock series. I'm going to try the other games eventually as well.

Amazing game, great story that will surprise you, great gameplay that will engage you. Easily one of the best game I've ever played.

10/10

Point négatif: La fin.

This is a really terrible game. I am glad I bought it dirt cheap - but I still paid too much. Junk.

Bioshock 1 was not that great, but in a different league to this rubbish.

It's a completely linear and very violent - pointlessly violent - shoot'em up with lousy weapons, ridiculous and pointless magic gestures, and absolutely no player power.

The worst - hard to say. The 'plot'? The lack of a save facility? The lousy graphics? The '1000 characters but only one face' nonsense? The pointlessness of it all? The rubbish sound? The pseudo-philosophical meandering quantum nonsense, the b-a-s-t-a-r-d-ised 'many-world' idiocy? The complete logical inconsistency of the ending?

The most offensive of all to me is both the completely linear nature of the game and the utter inability to avoid the two baptisms, which both offends and infuriates me.

Finally, as a sound person I note that Comstock's voice does not share the voice formants of Booker  dim Wit. I am unaware of any process whereby dim Wit could change formants to become  Commonstock. Totally ridiculous. How could they possibly be versions of the same person? They would have the same voice and the same formants, perhaps aged.

What a pity that this game is such rubbish. I do not understand how it got good reviews (though there were various reviewers that shared my opinion of it). I won't be getting the extensions.
Wow! This game is awesome. Loved the original Bioshock. I like the setting in this game a lot and the story and characters. Definitely worth picking up and playing through.
걸작중의 걸작.
História envolvente, jogabilidade perfeita para shooter, gráficos muito bons! Não tenho um defeito se quer pra falar. NOTA 10!

Bought it on sale. What a repetitive, boring, shallow game it is. I really can't understand the hype. I regret buying it.
People saying that it's a deep, immersive story clearly have never read a good book. It's not bad, but I could not really care for any of the characters. I'm truly surprised by how low people's standards are for a decent story. I guess most were just drooling over the girl.

It's basically a story, slowly developing and interrupted by repetitive, uninterested shooting galleries. It's utterly linear, the vigors are cute but most of them you never actually need. I got bored real quick and could not be bothered to finish it. I just completely lost interest due to the boring gameplay. I'd rather have seen the story in a miniseries than shooting everyone I meet. There is no depth here. There is just a cute girl, a story and gameplay that tries to hide how linear it is.

The game starts well. Good atmosphere, a few wtf moments... but as soon as the shooting starts you won't be doing anything else. It's like: kill everything, bit of story, kill everything, bit of story... pfffff.
the game you finish and then a week later you understand.
História sensacional, gameplay fluído, gráficos bonitos. Recomendo.
Ken Levine is a fucking god

This game is like a delicious meal at a top restaurant that gives you food poisoning. The story was great up until the ending. But even then, the ending of the base game only leaves you with a mild stomach ache. But the DLC is full on diahrea. With hindsight I would have given this game a pass. To me, a game like this is an interactive story, and the story is crap, even if the mechanics are solid. The first two games are much better.

***spoilers***
Its not the sad ending as such that annoys me, it was just badly written where Liz puts into events that are worse than if she did nothing. Plus the DLC basically invalidates the ending of the main game. And the ending of the main game is a stereotypical time travel paradox ending. The other thing I was dissapointed with was the lack of any fan service to bioshock 2. with all the time travel it would have been cool to see glimpses of Eleanor.

Can't describe this game.. 
Buy it

Bioshock infinite es un gran titulo con una gran historia, jugabilidad y unos graficos espectaculares.Aunque no sea igual a su antecesor aun mantiene su encanto con una banda sonora cuativadora a pesar de no poseer un modo cooperativo o un modo multijugador el juego el juego cotinua siendo excelente y con sus dlc bioshock infinite burial at sea (panteon marino) episodio 1 y 2 te brindan una nueva campaña, jugabilidad y una nueva historia.Sinceramente no me aburro de este juego.Recomiendo este titulo

You can send crows at your enemies and then shove a hook in their head while the crows eat their flesh
10/10
Что то не то, играя несколько часов не понял что к чему, куда то постоянно бежишь, причем по одним и тем же локацииям, вечные перестрелки, кароч какаето кол оф дути

B. I. O. S. H. O. C. K. - Své předky i tento díl neskryje... Z počátku jsem byl trošku skeptický vůči razantní změně prostředí, ale teď myslím,  že tato změna byla skutečně potřeba a jsem za ni rád. Do teď jsi pamatuji ten svůj úsměv, kdy jsem poprvé spatřil město v oblacích. Zkrátka tento díl byl výborným zakončením celé série. 

Hratelnost 8/10 - Dobrá, jako vždy, jen mi trochu vadila zpětná vazba ze střílení ale to je drobnost.
Příběh 10/10 - Příběh vás po celou dobu drží zaryté v křesle. Jen byl taaak krátký.
Grafika 9/10 - Grafika stárne. Ale můžu říct že i dnes se není za co stydět. 

Celkové hodnocení - Ze hry i po 6 letech neubylo ani trochu elánu, jen absence češtiny trochu zamrzí. 

8/10
Realy good game, if you haven't played it yet, you should

The mind behind Bioshock had his hands here, though restricted. I wish I could hear his plight because I felt it was a story with potential, narrative that grasped you and let you go. I would still recommend you to play this game but understand that this to me is a sad entry in the series and I cant help but be worried with how the story fell through. 

Most people were starstruck with the presentation and the bigger questions asked but at its core they didn't really represent much, I wasnt left changed. When I first stepped into Rapture I felt compelled to play because of the initial grab, the plight to save a family. I continued through rapture because I had my own agenda. I left Rapture with a different ideal.

When I first saw booker shoot some white supremecists on floating airships, I buckled in and he shot some more. Then some time travel shit was thrown his way so he shot his way through more white guys and now black people too, because fuckit muddled morality. Booker did stuff, I didn't. I could credit more to the aesthetics, design and fluidity but I largely respected this series to narrate me through a question I didnt know I had.
